{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Project Management Officer",
  "description": "Unified Payment Services Limitedis Nigeria&rsquo;s premier Payments &amp; Financial Technology company that operates as a shared infrastructure for the banking community in Nigeria and Payments Service Provider within and outside Nigeria, with a vision to be the most preferred e-payment service provider in Africa.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Project Management Officer
Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	The Project Management Officer (PMO) will support the planning, execution, monitoring, and successful delivery of projects across the organization.
	This role involves tracking project progress, maintaining documentation, coordinating with stakeholders, and ensuring adherence to timelines, budgets, and standards.
	The PMO will help implement project management best practices, streamline reporting, and contribute to the effective governance of the project portfolio within a dynamic fintech environment.


Responsibilities


	Support project planning activities, including scope definition, scheduling, resource allocation, and budgeting.
	Monitor and track progress across multiple projects to ensure timely delivery and alignment with business objectives.
	Maintain and update project documentation including project charters, plans, risk logs, and status reports.
	Assist in standardizing project management methodologies, tools, and templates across the organization.
	Coordinate with project teams to ensure tasks are assigned, deadlines are met, and risks/issues are addressed proactively.
	Organize and facilitate project review meetings, stakeholder briefings, and status update sessions.
	Prepare and present periodic project reports, dashboards, and performance metrics to leadership and stakeholders.
	Support the implementation of project governance processes and compliance with internal policies.
	Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure project alignment with strategic goals.
	Assist in post-project reviews, lessons learned, and continuous improvement initiatives.


Requirements
Education:


	Bachelor&rsquo;s degree in Project Management, Business Administration, Engineering, Information Technology, or a related field.
	A Master&rsquo;s degree or certification in project management or business-related field is an advantage.


Experience:


	Minimum of 4 years of experience in a project management, project coordination, or PMO support role, preferably in a fintech or technology-driven environment.
	Basic understanding of fintech industry operations, products, and project delivery models is an added advantage.


Technical Skills:


	Proficiency in project management tools (e.g., MS Project, JIRA, Asana, Trello, Monday.com).
	Knowledge of project management methodologies such as Agile, Waterfall, or hybrid approaches.
	Familiarity with project tracking and performance reporting systems.
	Understanding of risk and issue management, stakeholder engagement, and change control processes.


Certifications:


	Certifications such as Certified Associate in Project Management (CAPM), PRINCE2 Foundation, or Agile Scrum Foundation are beneficial.


Soft Skills:


	Strong organizational and time-management skills.
	Effective communication and interpersonal skills for stakeholder engagement.
	Analytical mindset with a problem-solving orientation.
	High attention to detail and accuracy.
	Ability to work collaboratively in a cross-functional team environment.


Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;opeoluwa.oluyemi@up-ng.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",
  "datePosted": "2025-10-18",
  "validThrough": "2025-12-01",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",

    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "Unified Payment Services Limited"
    
  },

Project Management Officer Job at Unified Payment Services Limited




        
    

        
        Unified Payment Services Limitedis Nigeria’s premier Payments & Financial Technology company that operates as a shared infrastructure for the banking community in Nigeria and Payments Service Provider within and outside Nigeria, with a vision to be the most preferred e-payment service provider in Africa.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Project Management Officer
Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

            
    




	The Project Management Officer (PMO) will support the planning, execution, monitoring, and successful delivery of projects across the organization.
	This role involves tracking project progress, maintaining documentation, coordinating with stakeholders, and ensuring adherence to timelines, budgets, and standards.
	The PMO will help implement project management best practices, streamline reporting, and contribute to the effective governance of the project portfolio within a dynamic fintech environment.


Responsibilities


	Support project planning activities, including scope definition, scheduling, resource allocation, and budgeting.
	Monitor and track progress across multiple projects to ensure timely delivery and alignment with business objectives.
	Maintain and update project documentation including project charters, plans, risk logs, and status reports.
	Assist in standardizing project management methodologies, tools, and templates across the organization.
	Coordinate with project teams to ensure tasks are assigned, deadlines are met, and risks/issues are addressed proactively.
	Organize and facilitate project review meetings, stakeholder briefings, and status update sessions.
	Prepare and present periodic project reports, dashboards, and performance metrics to leadership and stakeholders.
	Support the implementation of project governance processes and compliance with internal policies.
	Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure project alignment with strategic goals.
	Assist in post-project reviews, lessons learned, and continuous improvement initiatives.


Requirements
Education:


	Bachelor’s degree in Project Management, Business Administration, Engineering, Information Technology, or a related field.
	A Master’s degree or certification in project management or business-related field is an advantage.


Experience:


	Minimum of 4 years of experience in a project management, project coordination, or PMO support role, preferably in a fintech or technology-driven environment.
	Basic understanding of fintech industry operations, products, and project delivery models is an added advantage.


Technical Skills:


	Proficiency in project management tools (e.g., MS Project, JIRA, Asana, Trello, Monday.com).
	Knowledge of project management methodologies such as Agile, Waterfall, or hybrid approaches.
	Familiarity with project tracking and performance reporting systems.
	Understanding of risk and issue management, stakeholder engagement, and change control processes.


Certifications:


	Certifications such as Certified Associate in Project Management (CAPM), PRINCE2 Foundation, or Agile Scrum Foundation are beneficial.


Soft Skills:


	Strong organizational and time-management skills.
	Effective communication and interpersonal skills for stakeholder engagement.
	Analytical mindset with a problem-solving orientation.
	High attention to detail and accuracy.
	Ability to work collaboratively in a cross-functional team environment.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: opeoluwa.oluyemi@up-ng.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Front Desk Personnel",
  "description": "Starnet Innovations Limited is a leading technology company dedicated to delivering innovative solutions that drive digital transformation. With a team of highly skilled experts and a passion for technology, we are committed to providing cutting-edge solutions that help our clients stay ahead of the competition.

Founded on the principles of excellence, innovation, and customer satisfaction, we have established a reputation for delivering high-quality products and services that meet the ever-evolving needs of our clients. Our deep industry knowledge and technical expertise enable us to provide customized solutions that address the unique challenges of each business we serve.

At Starnet Innovations, we believe that technology has the power to change the world, and we are dedicated to using it to make a positive impact. Whether it&#39;s developing new software, implementing cutting-edge hardware, or providing exceptional technical support, we are dedicated to delivering value to our clients and helping them succeed.

We are recruiting smart, professional, and customer-focused young candidates&nbsp;to fill the position below:

Job Position: Front Desk Personnel&nbsp;

Job Location:&nbsp;Trans Ekulu, Enugu
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Brief


	This is a fantastic opportunity for a resident of Enugu to build a career in a professional environment.


Key Responsibilities


	Be the first point of contact for all visitors, providing a warm and professional welcome.
	Manage the reception area, ensuring it is tidy and presentable at all times.
	Handle all incoming calls, direct calls appropriately, and take accurate messages.
	Manage incoming and outgoing mail and correspondence.
	Provide basic and accurate information in-person and via phone/email.
	Perform other clerical duties such as filing, photocopying, and data entry as assigned.
	Maintain office security by following safety procedures and controlling access via the reception desk.


Requirements


	HND / BA / B.Sc Degree or equivalent; additional certification.
	Must be female and currently reside in Enugu.
	Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
	Pleasant and professional appearance with a friendly demeanor.
	Strong organizational and multi-tasking abilities.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel).
	Customer service orientation.


Salary
N50,000 Monthly.

Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;cv@starnetweb.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Note:&nbsp;For more enquiries, WhatsApp: +2348111770269.",

Front Desk Personnel Job at Starnet Innovations Limited




        
    

        
        Starnet Innovations Limited is a leading technology company dedicated to delivering innovative solutions that drive digital transformation. With a team of highly skilled experts and a passion for technology, we are committed to providing cutting-edge solutions that help our clients stay ahead of the competition.

Founded on the principles of excellence, innovation, and customer satisfaction, we have established a reputation for delivering high-quality products and services that meet the ever-evolving needs of our clients. Our deep industry knowledge and technical expertise enable us to provide customized solutions that address the unique challenges of each business we serve.
     

            
    



At Starnet Innovations, we believe that technology has the power to change the world, and we are dedicated to using it to make a positive impact. Whether it's developing new software, implementing cutting-edge hardware, or providing exceptional technical support, we are dedicated to delivering value to our clients and helping them succeed.

We are recruiting smart, professional, and customer-focused young candidates to fill the position below:

Job Position: Front Desk Personnel 

Job Location: Trans Ekulu, Enugu
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Brief


	This is a fantastic opportunity for a resident of Enugu to build a career in a professional environment.


Key Responsibilities


	Be the first point of contact for all visitors, providing a warm and professional welcome.
	Manage the reception area, ensuring it is tidy and presentable at all times.
	Handle all incoming calls, direct calls appropriately, and take accurate messages.
	Manage incoming and outgoing mail and correspondence.
	Provide basic and accurate information in-person and via phone/email.
	Perform other clerical duties such as filing, photocopying, and data entry as assigned.
	Maintain office security by following safety procedures and controlling access via the reception desk.


Requirements


	HND / BA / B.Sc Degree or equivalent; additional certification.
	Must be female and currently reside in Enugu.
	Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
	Pleasant and professional appearance with a friendly demeanor.
	Strong organizational and multi-tasking abilities.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel).
	Customer service orientation.


Salary
N50,000 Monthly.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: cv@starnetweb.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Note: For more enquiries, WhatsApp: +2348111770269.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Civil Engineer",
  "description": "Pentfield is a brand in the Housing/Construction sector of Africa&#39;s economy, incorporated in 2016 with the drive to bridging the noticeable gap that has been in existence between Luxury and Affordability. Poised to offer its clients and all stakeholders comfort and value-for-money, we are also geared towards delivering qualitative services through a seamless &amp; hitch-free handing-over/taking-over process that is time-bound.

We are recruiting to fill the position below

Job Position: Civil Engineer

Job Location:&nbsp;Abuja (FCT)&nbsp;
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	We are seeking a skilled and experienced Civil Engineer to join our dynamic team to oversee and manage structural and infrastructure aspects of our ongoing and upcoming developments.
	The Civil Engineer will be responsible for planning, designing, supervising, and managing construction projects to ensure structural integrity, cost efficiency, and compliance with standards. The ideal candidate must possess strong technical, analytical, and project management skills.


Key Responsibilities


	Oversee and manage all civil works and construction activities on project sites.
	Prepare, review, and interpret structural drawings and specifications.
	Ensure compliance with engineering standards, safety regulations, and building codes.
	Supervise site inspections and quality control processes.
	Coordinate with architects, contractors, and other engineers to ensure project alignment.
	Monitor progress and prepare technical reports on project status.
	Ensure timely completion of projects within budget and scope.
	Assist in the design and structural analysis of new development projects.
	Identify potential risks and recommend corrective actions.
	Report to the Project Manager and carryout other duties as assigned.


Requirements


	B.Sc. or HND in Civil Engineering.
	Minimum of 5 years of post NYSC experience in building construction, preferably within the real estate sector.
	COREN certification or in-view is an added advantage.
	Proficiency in AutoCAD, Revit, and other structural analysis software.
	Strong knowledge of construction materials, methods, and project management principles.
	Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
	Strong leadership, communication, and teamwork abilities.
	Attention to detail and high commitment to quality and safety standards.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send a copy of their CV (in PDF) to:&nbsp;hr@pentfield.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",

We are recruiting to fill the position below

Job Position: Civil Engineer

Job Summary
     

            
    




	We are seeking a skilled and experienced Civil Engineer to join our dynamic team to oversee and manage structural and infrastructure aspects of our ongoing and upcoming developments.
	The Civil Engineer will be responsible for planning, designing, supervising, and managing construction projects to ensure structural integrity, cost efficiency, and compliance with standards. The ideal candidate must possess strong technical, analytical, and project management skills.


Key Responsibilities


	Oversee and manage all civil works and construction activities on project sites.
	Prepare, review, and interpret structural drawings and specifications.
	Ensure compliance with engineering standards, safety regulations, and building codes.
	Supervise site inspections and quality control processes.
	Coordinate with architects, contractors, and other engineers to ensure project alignment.
	Monitor progress and prepare technical reports on project status.
	Ensure timely completion of projects within budget and scope.
	Assist in the design and structural analysis of new development projects.
	Identify potential risks and recommend corrective actions.
	Report to the Project Manager and carryout other duties as assigned.


Requirements


	B.Sc. or HND in Civil Engineering.
	Minimum of 5 years of post NYSC experience in building construction, preferably within the real estate sector.
	COREN certification or in-view is an added advantage.
	Proficiency in AutoCAD, Revit, and other structural analysis software.
	Strong knowledge of construction materials, methods, and project management principles.

title: Cashier Job at Amies Recruitment Agency
content:
Amies Recruitment Agency is a bridge company that connects employers to the right talent.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Cashier

Job Location: Life Camp, Abuja (FCT)
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	The Cashier will be responsible for managing daily cash transactions, recording sales, reconciling accounts, and ensuring accurate financial documentation for the gas plant.
	She will serve as the first point of contact for customers making payments and must maintain a high level of professionalism and integrity.


Key Responsibilities
     

            
    




	Receive payments for gas sales and other related transactions.
	Issue receipts and maintain accurate daily sales records.
	Reconcile daily cash and sales reports with management.
	Keep proper documentation of all financial transactions.
	Maintain cleanliness and organization at the sales point.
	Handle customer inquiries courteously and efficiently.
	Report discrepancies, shortages, or issues to the supervisor promptly.
	Assist in basic administrative tasks when required.


Requirements


	Candidates should possess an OND/NCE or equivalent qualification with 2-3 years of experience.
	Previous experience as a cashier or in a customer-facing role is an advantage.
	Must be female and single.
	Must reside in Life Camp or nearby areas.
	Strong numerical accuracy and attention to detail.
	Good communication and interpersonal skills.
	Honest, dependable, and punctual.
	Basic knowledge of record-keeping or Microsoft Excel is an added advantage.
	Preferred Gender: Female (Single)


Work Schedule:


	Full-time (including weekends, with one day off per week)


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Application and CV attached  to: amiesrecruitmentagency@gmail.com using "Application for Cashier - Gas Plant" as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Sales Executive",
  "description": "Pentfield is a brand in the Housing/Construction sector of Africa&#39;s economy, incorporated in 2016 with the drive to bridging the noticeable gap that has been in existence between Luxury and Affordability. Poised to offer its clients and all stakeholders comfort and value-for-money, we are also geared towards delivering qualitative services through a seamless &amp; hitch-free handing-over/taking-over process that is time-bound.

We are recruiting to fill the position below

Job Positon: Sales Executive

Job Location:&nbsp;Abuja (FCT)&nbsp;
Employment Type: Full-time

Job&nbsp;Description


	The Sales Executive will be responsible for identifying potential clients, building strong relationships, and closing sales deals for our properties.
	This role involves proactive prospecting, managing leads, conducting site inspections, and meeting or exceeding sales targets while delivering excellent customer service.


Responsibilities


	Achieving growth and hitting sales targets.
	Support in the design and implementation of strategic sales plans that expand the company&rsquo;s customer base and ensure its strong presence.
	Develop&nbsp;and&nbsp;maintainexcellent&nbsp;relationships&nbsp;with&nbsp;clients.
	Advise&nbsp;clients&nbsp;on&nbsp;market&nbsp;conditions,&nbsp;prices,mortgages,&nbsp;legal&nbsp;requirements&nbsp;and related matters.
	Support the BDM to coordinate property&nbsp;closings, signing&nbsp;of&nbsp;documents&nbsp;and&nbsp;disbursement&nbsp;of funds.
	Preparation&nbsp;and&nbsp;submission&nbsp;of&nbsp;weekly&nbsp;and&nbsp;monthly&nbsp;reports.
	Updating&nbsp;the&nbsp;clients weekly.
	Remaining&nbsp;knowledgeable&nbsp;about&nbsp;real&nbsp;estatemarkets&nbsp;and&nbsp;best&nbsp;practices.
	Report to the Business Development Manager (BDM)
	Perform&nbsp;other duties&nbsp;as&nbsp;assigned&nbsp;by&nbsp;the&nbsp;MD&nbsp;and Chairman.


Requirements


	A Degree or its equivalent in Marketing, Business Administration, Estate Management, or related field.
	Proven sales experience in the real estate sector (2+ years preferred).
	Strong knowledge of the real estate market.
	Excellent communication, negotiation, and interpersonal skills.
	Confident, goal-driven, and result-oriented.
	Ability to work independently and as part of a team.


Salary
N100,000 - N150,000 / month.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send a copy of their CV (in PDF) to:&nbsp;hr@pentfield.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",

Sales Executive Job at Pentfield




        
    

        
        Pentfield is a brand in the Housing/Construction sector of Africa's economy, incorporated in 2016 with the drive to bridging the noticeable gap that has been in existence between Luxury and Affordability. Poised to offer its clients and all stakeholders comfort and value-for-money, we are also geared towards delivering qualitative services through a seamless & hitch-free handing-over/taking-over process that is time-bound.

We are recruiting to fill the position below

Job Positon: Sales Executive

Job Location: Abuja (FCT) 
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description
     

            
    




	The Sales Executive will be responsible for identifying potential clients, building strong relationships, and closing sales deals for our properties.
	This role involves proactive prospecting, managing leads, conducting site inspections, and meeting or exceeding sales targets while delivering excellent customer service.


Responsibilities


	Achieving growth and hitting sales targets.
	Support in the design and implementation of strategic sales plans that expand the company’s customer base and ensure its strong presence.
	Develop and maintainexcellent relationships with clients.
	Advise clients on market conditions, prices,mortgages, legal requirements and related matters.
	Support the BDM to coordinate property closings, signing of documents and disbursement of funds.
	Preparation and submission of weekly and monthly reports.
	Updating the clients weekly.
	Remaining knowledgeable about real estatemarkets and best practices.
	Report to the Business Development Manager (BDM)
	Perform other duties as assigned by the MD and Chairman.


Requirements


	A Degree or its equivalent in Marketing, Business Administration, Estate Management, or related field.
	Proven sales experience in the real estate sector (2+ years preferred).
	Strong knowledge of the real estate market.
	Excellent communication, negotiation, and interpersonal skills.
	Confident, goal-driven, and result-oriented.
	Ability to work independently and as part of a team.


Salary
N100,000 - N150,000 / month.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send a copy of their CV (in PDF) to: hr@pentfield.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.
